Posts.Content: mamanmidwife wrote: Hey all, just wanted to update as i had my CAT scan last week and got the results today. of the 4 lesions in my liver 2 got smaller and 2 remained the same or got smaller by 1 mm. the biggest one got shrank 1 whole cm (from 5.7cm down to 4.7 cm). of the lesions on T10 and T12 they can't see the one on T10 anymore and T12 is getting smaller. Needless to say I am a happy camper! for 3-4 months in any case. I will be going for my exchange sx this wed, and will continue to plan my small getaways Miami and a short cruise with DD#1 in 2 weeks, St Pete's Beach next month! You all give such great support here and i am so grateful! thanks you again Gigi Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: reggie and the stable boys!!! mamanmidwife Leah_S

Posts.Title: reggie and the stable boys!!! mamanmidwife Leah_S

Posts.Content: mamanmidwife wrote: sorry guys, but my bone scan and cat scan are tomorrow and even with the valium i am just sitting here with literally every part of my body hurting (obviously i have mets to all the parts of me) I was the one complaining about pain, so i shouldn't be surprised my onc wants scans, but it doesn't help with the anxiety, grrr. this is just so hard i have access to my records, but usually wait to get the results (next thurs) but i also usually have a little vacation in between. all i have this time is a day trip to atlantic city with my mom and my grandmother... we'll see how long i can not look at the results. oh well, this is our lot isn't it. living scan to scan.... boy, i really hate this freakin disease Gigi Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: mounting SCANXIETY mamanmidwife Moderators

Posts.Content: mamanmidwife wrote: Hi everyone, I'm Gigi 45 yo single mother of 3 girls 19,17,and 9. a midwife (lucky that i love my job). I have had a ridiculous month from a wnl mammo 1/2009 to a highly suspicious one 4/26 - core biopsy of a mass in my right breast 5/5/10 to a diagnosisi of IDC 5/7/10. ok that sucks, but what do we next? well proceed to a PET scan and MRI which shows a "hot spot" in the liver and on t12. well i've been know to party a bit i am entitled to a little liver dmage go for the liver biopsy with high hope only to have them dashed last week. I am officiall stage IV with mets to liver and bone. WTF?! Ok so what do we do now? well first off lets get (what my mom clls) "the Taliban AKA home grown terrorists" out of my body i go to schedual my lap hyst ooph (have fibroids and adenomysis) today. and it can't be done until 7/9/10. my onc thinks it's too long to wait and wants me on lupron and femera tomorrow. WTH? I am leaving for Cozumel to certify in SCUBA diving (did the class for my birthday gift to myself in april - before any of this nonsense) on saturday.  figure the mexican heat will hide my hotflashes and the water will feel good. I feel very bleessed in the sense that i feel great exactly the same as before hearing about this war going on in my body. I have a sense of faith and know that hatever happens it's going to be ok, but each bit of news has been hard. and silly as it seems i would have preferred to have the surgery ,and still want it i guess to me it seems more hopeful to have the surgery because that would mean i expect to be around a long time. We celebrated my granmother's 90th birthday last year an she was the last one on the dance floor , both my parents are doing well in there 70's i reall can;'t see myself doing much less then they are. Wish me luck. I plan on having an absolute blast in Cozumel and exploring he new world under the water. You ladies are an inspiration and another blessing thanks for being here gigi new member of the club Gigi Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: allow me to introduce myself - remix mamanmidwife MaryanneL

Posts.Content: mamanmidwife wrote: Hi everyone, I just wanted to check in since i am going for my ooph tomorrow. I has a spectacular time on my dive trip to cozumel. I really don't know  why i am walking on land i belong in the water lol. when i got back had to get this surgery scheduled, started on the tamoxiphen, caught a cold, started haveing hot flashes (or is it the 100 degree weather we are having), and going to work, going to my 17 year olds graduation, taking my 9 yo to great adventure and the fireworks.... you know living life. I haven't come to the boards until today, i was surprised i didn't fin time for it, but i guess i needed a hiatus (or a little float on the river of De Nial). i'm sure the surgery will be straight forward , but as a nurse just dislike having surgery in july (new residents come on board). it is ambulatory surgery so i am really glad about that. i'll be home for 2 weeks and i will be able to catch up. well think positive thoughts or prayers for me tomorrow Gigi  Gigi Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: checking in before my ooph mamanmidwife LC815

Posts.Content: mamanmidwife wrote: Hey everyone, It seems i am hard headed, no matter how many times PJB writes about guts and bowel hygeine i needed to see for myself on tramadol and percocet every 8 hours for pain, and i just let it get away from me 1 week with no bm. when it was time to go after senna tea, prep h and an enema, it still felt like cacti coming out... no fun felt like i was going to pass out soo once again bowel hygeine is super important Gigi Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Oh my 'rhhoids (TMI ahead) mamanmidwife Fitztwins

Posts.Content: mamanmidwife wrote: Had a Pet scan last friday and it "saw" something on my liver, now need a liver biopsy, ugh! has anyone had one? i like to hear about it before so as to prepare myself. This alien invasion is reall messing with me. (my liver function test were fine, so i am not really worried yet about the biopsy, just want to know "how it feels") thnaks - Gigi Gigi Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: PET Scan mamanmidwife mamanmidwife

Posts.Content: mamanmidwife wrote: Hi all, I'm gigi and as of monday a new member of the club i would have never thought i'd be joining. I am the single mom of 3 girls (19,17, and 9) and work as a midwife. this alien invasion of my body is royally pissing me off! my preliminary diagnosis is IDC of the right breast after the core biopsy. I've met with the woman who i am leaning towards being my oncologist(i like her a lot) but i always have to examine my choices to feel good about my decisions. will have the MRI and Pet scan this week. meeting the surgeon next week. Treatment (surgery or chemo) will begin 6/21/10, because I will be going to Cozumel to do my certifying open water dives and SCUBA diving for a week. I can't think of a better way to start this battle. I am still absolutely flabbergasted at this thing. This is not a journey i was planning on taking at any point but esp not now. oh well the best laid plans of mice and men. I love my breast small though they are and will miss it/them terribly. I will miss my hair and will have my sister get me wigs short bob for work medium for the weekedns and the long one for diva times. I am afraid of chemo, but i will get through it because i have no choice. Listening the the oldies station and heard Queen's "we are the champions" and felt that it would be my theme song. I've been told already that i and a "role-model" and "inspiration" and that everyone "know you'll get through this , because you have such a good attitude" and too all that i say bullcrap! I don't want to be in this position at all. I've looked through this board and the site and you women are truly inspirational and seem to keep it real. The way i like it. thanking you in advance Gigi we are the champions my friends, we'll keep on fighting to the end.... Gigi Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Allow me to introduce myself... mamanmidwife jenbal

Posts.Content: mamanmidwife wrote: I finished my couch to 5k and ran my first 5k yest (well ran 33 min 1.5 miles then walked/ran the rest) I am so proud of myself i finished the whole thing in 54 min 10 (so you see i can walk faster than i jog lol). I am really proud of me! i need a heating pad on my back and icepacks on my knees and  ankles, but i made it to work today. I also got to see my 10 yo who's been staying out on long island with my sister and her cousins, and she's brown as a chocolat chip cookie (my ex is french, so my kids can be a bit pale to my eyes). Now of course tomorrow i go to the onc and talk about changing antihormonals, oh well. and friday i get to go to family court because my ex wants to remove my 21 yo from his child support (about $40/week) mind you she goes away to college and he hasn't helped with that one bit for the last 3 years, but whatever... i think of you ladies so much, so just sharing a bit of the real stuff with you, thanks for listening to me ramble Gigi Dx 5/7/2010, IDC, 2cm, Stage IV, Grade 2, 0/0 nodes, mets, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: OT - I did it! mamanmidwife reesie
